title: Dire Wolves’ Worlds journey comes to an end

replies.body: Hey, keep practicing and give it another hell of a go next year :)
Keep up the hard work lads. Im sure Cloud 9 were very scared in the second game. xD

It's a pity they didn't beat the Brazilians because they would only have to defeat Turkey to get to the group stage. Having said that though, they didn't deserve to progress any further.
Until OCE teams hire people that can train their teams in macro, decision making, and communication, they will keep missing out on the international stage. Unfortunately there is only one team in the OPL that has such a trainer, and their players are lucklustre compared to Dire Wolves :(

Sharp, if you are reading this, I can help you guys out, send me an email that I can contact you on.

from an outsiders view they didn't respect their opponents in game 3. They were overconfident and kept fighting team one on their terms and eventually started losing. This started a snowballing tilt against them that they were not mentally able to break out of.

Seriously talented team but needs to look at learning how to play from behind and for everyone to keep their s***t together when things start falling apart.
Their blood got splattered across the monitor screens{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}

idk man, DW made a lot of silly mistakes that they weren't willing to try to learn from. Phantiks carried them to Worlds on Viktor then played 3 out of 4 games on the Corki with fairly lacklustre performances.

DW were never making it out of Play-Ins, but they should have at least made it out of the Group Stage.
